feed.title: Stryker Stinnette | Web Developer Portfolio
feed.subtitle: My Name is Stryker Stinnette and I am a Web Developer, Web Designer, and Data Analyst. Full Stack Developer for LAMP, ASP.NET, and WordPress.

entry.title: Welcome to Jekyll!
entry.content:
You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

To add new posts, simply add a file in the _posts directory that follows the convention YYYY-MM-DD-name-of-post.ext and includes the necessary front matter. Take a look at the source for this post to get an idea about how it works.

Jekyll also offers powerful support for code snippets:

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll’s GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on Jekyll Talk.
entry.summary: You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

entry.title: Contract and Cross Reference Employee Web Application

link.title: Contract and Cross Reference Employee Web Application

entry.content:
Contract and Cross Reference Employee Web Application



Quick Summary

This application (1) lets Echo employees view and update information on contracts and (2) cross references employees from Echo's Customer's payroll database to Echo's payroll database.
More Information


What Problems this Application Solves ?

1. Contract information gets stale. The employees that know the most about the contracts do not have a way to log into the accounting program and update contracts.

2. Customer sends in Employee Codes and Names with Hours worked, but they do not match Echo's Employee Codes.


Who was the Application Intended for ?

This application was built for multiple people and departments including: Plant Managers, Project Managers, Estimators, and Accounting.


Client: The Echo Group
Website: (An internal website that only certain employees have access to.)
Date: 2/10/2018
Framework: ASP.Net MVC
Programming: C#, JQuery, Bootstrap 3, HTML, and CSS
Services: Web Development, Web Design, UI Design, Custom Web Application Development
GitHub Repo: github.com/StrykerKent/TrackSageEmployeeCrossReference




Let's walk through the application:



The user first comes to a landing page where they can choose to view Contracts or Employees. (Job Set Up is phase 3 of the application and has not been started.)

Contract Section. The user can view contracts that are tied to the site they are working at. They can also update any information on the contract. The fields across the top are to help filter the list of contracts. There is also a download to excel feature.

Employee Section. The user can lookup employees by name or by employee id. User can add another site for an employee to be associated with or change an employee's code.

Employee Cross Reference Section. The user can also see all employees that came through Track (from the customer) that do not match Echo Employee Codes. The user then clicks on the name (in the top table) and the application shows possible matches (in the bottom table). The application does the searching, but I told it how to search using C# and SQL. The user can then fill out more information about the employee to narrow down the search for the correct Echo Employee with correct Employee Code. If they found the correct employee, the user double clicks that line and the information that ties the Track Employee Code to the Echo Employee code is written to the database (in a relational table).



Back to Portfolio

entry.title: Weld Shop Production, Quality Control, and Material Tracking Web Application

link.title: Weld Shop Production, Quality Control, and Material Tracking Web Application

entry.content:
Weld Shop Production, Quality Control, and Material Tracking Web Application


This client wanted a better way to track projects than using paper and calling shop foreman for updates. With the help of a Production Manager, I was able to come up with this weld / production tracker web application. This application was developed using ASP.NET MVC, C#, JQuery, HTML, and CSS. The user has the ability to upload pipe information from a drafting program and into this web application.

The Web App Design and friendly User Interface was designed by myself with additional ideas from Project Managers and the Head of IT. This application was built for multiple people and departments including: Engineering, Project Managers, Shop Foreman, Quality Control (QAQC), Receiving, and the Plant Manager.

This application helps these users and departments track their work with less interuptions and less paperwork. This is the most in depth Web Application I have built to date.


Client: Gulf Coast Fabricators (part of The Echo Group)
Website: (An internal website that only employees have access to.)
Date: 1/5/2018
Service: Web Development, Web Design, UX Design, Custom Web Application Development, Custom Reporting



Back to Portfolio

More pictures below

entry.title: Purchase Order Web Application
entry.content:
Purchase Order Web Application


The client wanted an internal Purchase Order System to keep track of what the company was buying. I worked with the Plant Manager and the Accounts Receivable person to create a custom Purchase Order System that fit thier business. This site was developed using ASP.NET, C#, JQuery, HTML, and CSS.

The Web App Design and friendly User Interface were designed by myself. Functionality was a team effort between the Plant Manager, Accounts Receivable person, and myself.

Client: Gulf Coast Exchanger
Website: (An internal website that only employees have access to.)
Date: 8/25/2015
Service: Web Development, Web Design, UI



<< Back to Portfolio

entry.title: Equipment Transfer Web Application
entry.content:
Equipment Transfer Web Application


Live Demo

This was a proof of concept for a client that was having trouble keeping up with their equipment and the location it was in. They wanted a Mobile Web Application they could use on their phone and desktops for requesting equipment transfers.

The app grabs the user's geo location and allows the user to upload a picture of the equipment. It also has fields for the user to fill out about the equipment to complete the request. This was developed using PHP, MySQL, JQuery, HTML, and CSS.
The design and user experience were designed by myself.


Client: Echo Maintenance
Demo Website: https://sksapp.000webhostapp.com/
Date: 12/17/2017
Service: Mobile Web Development, User Experience, PHP & MySQL Stack



<< Back to Portfolio

entry.title: The Echo Group Website
entry.content:
The Echo Group Website


The Echo Group Website was built using Wordpress, PHP, JQuery, HTML, CSS, and Bootstrap. This was an update to their 2013 non-responsive site. All logos and images were touched up (using Adobe Illustrator) and replaced with high resolution versions. This site was built to showcase the companies that make up The Echo Group and to help with the new branding strategy (moving away from Echo Maintenance being the main company). Some of the pictures were taken by myself and LaBouve Marketing. Copy was written by the Echo Group Head Estimator, Echo Group Marketing Analyst, and myself.

Client: The Echo Group
Website: www.echogroupllc.net
Date: 2/10/2017
Service: Web Development, Web Design, Marketing, SEO, Responsive Design, Branding, Create Copy and Content



<< Back to Portfolio

entry.title: Bid Log Web Application (Gulf Coast Fabricators & Exchanger)

link.title: Bid Log Web Application (Gulf Coast Fabricators & Exchanger)

entry.content:
Bid Log Web Application (Gulf Coast Fabricators & Exchanger)


This Bid Log Web Application was build on the ASP.NET MVC platform using ASP.NET, MVC, C#, Microsoft SQL Server, JQuery, HTML, and CCS. Extra form validation was created by me for this Web Application via Jquery, C#, and MVC Data Notations to help users put in correct data. Built for functionality, user interface, and ease of use.


Client: Gulf Coast Fabricatiors, Gulf Coast Exchanger
Website: (An Intranet employees only have access to.)
Date: 11/15/2015
Service: Web Development, Database Application, User Interface, Ease of Use



<< Back to Portfolio
